text: Ken Coleman (April 22, 1925 - August 21, 2003) was an American sportscaster. He was a play-by-play announcer for telecasts for the Cleveland Indians and the Cleveland Browns. He also called NFL and Major League Baseball games for NBC as well as college football games. He was the voice of the Boston Red Sox and Cincinnati Reds. Coleman as called Major League Baseball games for ABC and NFL games for Sports Network Incorporation. title: Ken Coleman
